caption.p: Modes accompanying organelle evolution. Multiple modes have been suggested for the evolution of paralogous genes involved in specifying organellar identity (see text). Gene duplication increases the number of paralogs, while sculpting decreases through gene loss. Churning can operate without an obvious or significant change to paralog number but represents the birth and death of paralogous, functionally equivalent genes while backfilling is the result of both gene loss and compensatory expansion of an unrelated gene family to suppress the impact of the initial loss
